comment.author: 79037172@N04
comment._content: Cap badge and collar dogs are of the Royal Artillery.

comment.author: 104240447@N08
comment._content:
Forgive me if I am wrong but I'll give it my best:

2nd Lieutenant Harold Bingham served with the Royal Field Artillery, "C" Bty, 78th Bde. He died Sept. 15, 1918 and is buried at Rocquigny-Equancourt Road British Cemetery, Manancourt, France. This cemetery was near a casualty clearing station. The 78th Brigade RFA participated in the Battle of Havrincourt on Sept. 12, 1918 so I would guess Lt. Bingham was wounded on or around this day, transported 16km south west to the casualty clearing station at Manancourt and unfortunately passed away there 3 days later at the age of 34. He had a wife named Mabel.

I hope this info is correct, As I said before, rest in peace sir and thank you.

comment.author: 104240447@N08
comment._content: I would like to give credit to CWGC for some of the info included in my above comment.
